Dikira Diculik, Bocah 14 Tahun Ternyata Kabur dan Sewa Apartemen
07 Nov 2019, 20:46 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah
Jakarta - Seorang bocah laki-laki berusia 14 tahun sempat dilaporkan hilang dan diculik. Usut punya usut, bocah itu rupanya tidak diculik, melainkan kabur dari rumah dan menyewa apartemen.
Bermula saat orang tua korban membuat laporan polisi pada Selasa (5/11) kemarin. Orang tua melaporkan adanya dugaan penculikan terhadap korban.
"Setelah Tim Resmob menelusuri laporan seorang perempuan yaitu ibunya bahwa anaknya diculik, karena keluarga ini sendiri-sendiri antara bapak dengan ibunya sudah sendiri-sendiri (berpisah) dan anak ini ikut bapaknya," kata Kabid Humas Polda Metro Jaya Kombes Argo Yuwono kepada wartawan di Polda Metro Jaya, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).
"Tanpa sepengetahuan bapaknya, anak ini pergi meninggalkan rumah. Kemudian anak itu membawa sebuah SIM bapaknya," sambungnya.
Setelah diusut polisi pada tanggal 7 November 2019, polisi menemukan bocah itu sedang berada di apartemen di wilayah Jakarta Selatan. Ternyata bocah itu pergi dari rumah dan menyewa apartemen untuk dia tempati.
"Sudah kita lakukan interogasi ke anaknya bahwa anaknya itu dia kepengen belajar dengan tenang, tidak ada gangguan-gangguan. Kalau di rumah bapaknya ada gangguan, kurang tenang makannya dia mencari tempat yaitu di apartemen di Jaksel," jelas Argo.
Polisi kemudian membawa bocah itu ke Polda Metro Jaya dan memanggil kedua orang tua bocah itu. Polisi juga menanyakan kepada sang ibu perihal si ibu yang menyebutkan bahwa anaknya diculik.
Polisi juga sudah menyerahkan bocah itu ke pihak keluarganya. Argo mengimbau kepada masyarakat agar memberikan pengawasan lebih ke anak-anaknya.
"Kita imbau ke orang tua yang punya anak baik anak itu dalam suatu keluarga yang broken home maupun dalam satu keluarga yang ada masalah tentunya anak nggak bisa dibiarkan untuk menanggung apa yang diakibatkan orang tua," kata Argo.
Dalam kesempatan yang sama, orang tua bocah itu berinisial H mengucapkan terimakasih kepada pihak Polda Metro Kaya karena sudah menemukan anaknya. H merasa sudah merepotkan pihak kepolisian karena awalnya dia merasa anaknya diculik namun nyatanya anaknya tidak diculik.
"Kepergian anak kami yang kami sangka selama ini dia diculik itu ternyata kepergian dari mereka sendiri. Jadi anak kami sehat dan saat ini kami mau pulang. Kami mengucapkan terima kasih kepada Bapak Kapolda yang sudah dibikin repot sampai jajaran bawahnya untuk mencari anak kami," kata H.

(sam/mea)

Thought Kidnapped, 14-Year-Old Boy Turns Blurred and Apartments Rent
Nov 7 2019, 20:46 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah
Jakarta - A 14-year-old boy was reported missing and kidnapped. Investigate a investigate, the boy apparently was not kidnapped, but ran away from home and rented an apartment.
It started when the victim's parents made a police report on Tuesday (5/11) yesterday. Parents report alleged abduction of the victim.
"After the Resmob Team traced a woman's report, namely her mother, that her child had been kidnapped, because this family was alone between father and mother, they were separated (separated) and this child joined his father," Metro Jaya Police Public Relations Commissioner Argo Yuwono told reporters at Polda Metro Jaya, Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019).
"Without the knowledge of his father, this child left the house. Then the child brought a license of his father," he continued.
After being investigated by the police on November 7, 2019, the police found the boy in an apartment in the South Jakarta area. It turned out that the boy left home and rented an apartment for him to occupy.
"We have already conducted an interrogation with his son that he wants to study quietly, there are no disturbances. If there is a disturbance at his father's house, he is not calm, so he looks for a place in the apartment in South Jakarta," Argo explained.
The police then took the boy to the Jakarta Police and called the boy's parents. The police also asked the mother about the mother who mentioned that her child had been kidnapped.
The police have also handed the boy over to his family. Argo appealed to the community to provide more supervision to their children.
"We appeal to parents who have children both children in a broken home family or in a family that has problems of course the child can not be allowed to bear what is caused by parents," Argo said.
On the same occasion, the boy's parents initialed H expressed his gratitude to the Rich Metro Regional Police for finding their children. H felt that it was troublesome to the police because at first he felt his son was kidnapped but in fact his child was not kidnapped.
"The departure of our child, who we thought he was kidnapped for, turned out to be the departure of themselves. So our child is healthy and now we want to go home. We thank Mr. Kapolda who has been bothered to the lower ranks to find our children," said H.

(sam / mea)
